root: ^You approach the Shopkeep once more, determined to be more subtle.

shopkeep_1: ^"Hmm? Oh it's the witch. What do you want?"
^"Just to thank you for all your hard work." you say.

s: ^"You are a pillar of the community
c: ^, without you we would not be half the village we are today!"
^The Shopkeep smiles broadly, "You are spot on there miss."

s: ^"And I was hoping you could help me
c: ^?" The Shopkeep's face clouds over. "Unrelated to the current witchhunt," You add quickly. "of course."
^"They certainly do!" He says proudly. "People is always asking me for special favors, special items now and again."

s: ^"You must know everything that goes on
c: ^"What are you getting at?" He seems suspicious.

shopkeep_2: ^"Ahh! Of Course! Anything you could possibly need young miss! Goods, sundries, something for your beau perhaps? I've a wealth of books at the moment."
shopkeep_2_1: ^"No idea. Can't read myself. Here's the inventory if you like." He hands you a sheaf of parchment.
^"Why do you have an inventory if you can't- Oh never mind." You examine the list.
shopkeep_2_2: ^"Just t'other day, the Priest comes in all in a huff, going on about his book orders- he needs 'em now he says! No one needs books, I say!"

c: ^ The first page contains orders for hymnals and blank parchment.
^ The second page is a list of obscure religious texts.
^ There is a single entry. "For the Priest: 'Proctor's Practical Witchcraft'"

shopkeep_3: ^"A book on Witchcraft! Plain as day!" You exclaim excitedly.
^"What!?" The Shopkeeper is outraged. "I never should have trusted him! Bloody clergy..."
^You are relieved. At least someone believes you, even if it's the Shopkeeper.
